title: What are some examples of white dwarf stars? - Quora

response.answer_text: I wanted to offer a size comparison of the 10 closest white dwarfs, but couldn’t find information on the radii for LP 145-141 (4th nearest), Stein 2051 B (6th nearest), LP 44-113 (7th nearest) and G 99-44 (8th nearest). So instead, here are the 6 nearest white dwarf stars excluding those four[1]:  Sirius, Procyon, van Maanen’s Star, 40 Eridani, L 97-12, Wolf 489 In the top left corner you can see an outline of the size of Jupiter, on the right side an outline of the Sun and in the top right an outline of the Earth for reference. Earth is 109% the size of Sirius B. Footnotes[1] List of white dwarfs - Wikipedia

Some of the nearest examples of white dwarf stars include: Sirius  Sirius B is the smaller blue light (the big white orb is Sirius A) Procyon  Procyon B is the white dwarf in this companion system Van Maanen  Illustration of Van Maanen LP 145-141  LP 145–141 on a star chart 40 Eridani  40 Eridani Stein 2051  Stein 2051 L 97-12  Generic white dwarf illustration because I couldn't find a photo of L 97–12.
